definition: miniature version of sth/microcosm/epitome/(Tw) to microfilm
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: Now you can have your own miniature version courtesy of Mathmos.
sentences.chinese: 現在您可以讓您的Mathmos自己的縮影禮貌。

sentences.english: The declining family circumstances of the Compsons is the symbol of the dying away of the old South tradition.
sentences.chinese: 康普生的家境衰敗就是蓄奴制舊南方衰亡的縮影。

sentences.english: "The Reeds"is obviously the epitome of this tragedy in which love succumbs to the feudal ethical code.
sentences.chinese: 《蒹葭》正是這種“愛”屈服於“禮”悲劇的縮影。

sentences.english: The changes of Chinese ancient bowl bottom is the epitome of the whole ancient ceramic history.
sentences.chinese: 碗底足的變遷是整個古陶瓷歷史變遷的一個縮影。

sentences.english: In a sense, Chongryon is a mirror for North Korea itself.
sentences.chinese: 某種意義上來說，聯合總會是朝鮮歷史的縮影。

sentences.english: Sendai is a microcosm of what ails Japan.
sentences.chinese: 仙台市的現狀，就是整個日本的縮影。

sentences.english: The story behind the death of the stand-alone camera is a history of the future of almost everything.
sentences.chinese: 照相機之死背後的故事可以說是一切事物未來的縮影。

sentences.english: This historical novel illustrates the breaking up of feudal society in microcosm.
sentences.chinese: 這部歷史小說是走向崩潰的封建社會的縮影。

sentences.english: A complete treasury of Shakespeare will be available to public in the form of microfiches .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亞的全集將以縮影出版，內容介紹。

sentences.english: To some extent, school curriculum are the epitome of human culture.
sentences.chinese: 因此從某種程度說，學校課程是人類文化史的縮影。

sentences.english: In the museum there is a miniature of the ship"Mayflower."
sentences.chinese: 在博物館裏有一對船“五月花的一個縮影。”

sentences.english: This was the epitome of the "open source" leadership model in action.
sentences.chinese: 這件事情是“開源”領導模式發揮作用的一個縮影。

sentences.english: In theory, Congress is supposed to represent a microcosm of America.
sentences.chinese: 從理論上講，國會應該是美國的一個縮影。

sentences.english: It's a microcosm. It is a distillation or quintessence.
sentences.chinese: 是真實世界的縮影，也是精華和本質的東西。

sentences.english: The Atom whirls alone, the epitome of singleness.
sentences.chinese: 原子獨自旋轉，典型的單一性縮影。

sentences.english: Ray-Ban eyeglasses are the epitome of high fashion.
sentences.chinese: “雷朋”眼鏡都是高級時裝的縮影。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
